Package main

Class Crew

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.Crew
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.util.Observer
    public class Crew
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.util.Observer
    This class implements the crew. Each crew has a list of members, medical items, food items, a ship, a balance, and a name. Each time the game is run, an object of type Crew is created. Each game can only have one Crew object. It implements Observer and observes RandomEventGenerator to be informed whenever a random event occurs
    Author:
    Hamesh Ravji, Jackie Qiu

      private java.util.ArrayList<MedicalItem> medicalItems

    • Constructor Detail

      • Crew

        public Crew​(java.lang.String name,
            Ship ship,
            int initialBalance,
            java.util.ArrayList<CrewMember> crew,
            java.util.ArrayList<MedicalItem> initialMedicalItems,
            java.util.ArrayList<FoodItem> initialFoodItems,
            GameEnvironment incomingEnvironment)
        The Constructor, takes parameters which are passed from setup
        Parameters:
        name - A string of the name of the Crew that the user chose in the setup
        ship - The Ship object that the user named in the setup
        initialBalance - The amount of money that the crew starts with as an integer
        crew - The ArrayList of CrewMember objects that the user chose in the setup
        initialMedicalItems - The ArrayList of initial MedicalItem objects
        initialFoodItems - The ArrayList of initial FoodItem objects
        incomingEnvironment - The GameEnvironment which keeps track of the state of the game

      • showInventory

        public java.lang.String showInventory()
        Produces a summary of the players inventory such as the balance, items and their quantities
        Returns:
        A string showing the players inventory

      • update

        public void update​(java.util.Observable generator,
                   java.lang.Object arg)
        Implements the update method which is called whenever it is notified by the RandomEventGenerator class which Crew observes. Whenever the generator object of RandomEventGenerator notifies it observers, this method is called which uses the included argument to determine what needs to be updated in Crew
        Specified by:
        update in interface java.util.Observer
        Parameters:
        generator - The RandomEventGenerator that Crew observes
        arg - The argument which could be an ArrayList of CrewMembers, a FoodItem, a MedicalItem, or a double

      • updateStatistics

        public void updateStatistics()
        For each crew member, it calls the endOfDayAdjustments method from CrewMember to adjust their statistics as necessary. If any crew members are dead after the adjustments, they are removed from the list of crew members
